page.title: 04The Copplestone Tree
page.content: Just outside the gates of the graveyard is a great oak called the Copplestone tree. It is about 200-300 years old. It is hollow and people usually have their wedding photographs beside it. There are a great many rumours about it and the most truthful of all is how it got its name. Here is the story:one Sunday afternoon Christopher Copplestone the Lord of the Manor in the 16th century was very angry with his grandson. In the end he got so angry with him that he took a knife and stabbed him a number of times in the heart and killed him in the exact spot where the tree stands. Another rumour is that if you go there exactly at midnight and walk round the tree ten times then step inside it, it will close in on you and you will fall down below the church.
